text: Take a Number is the debut album by New Zealand and Polynesian jazz singer Mavis Rivers. It was arranged by Nelson Riddle and released in 1959. ==Reception== The initial Billboard magazine review from May 18, 1959 commented that "Polynesian canary Mavis Rivers lends her expressive jazz- flavored thrushing style to a group of "number" selections...Spinnable wax". ==Track listing== # "One Minute to One" (J. Fred Coots, Sam M. Lewis) – 2:32 # "Two Loves Have I" – 4:03 # "Three Coins in the Fountain" (Sammy Cahn, Jule Styne) – 3:12 # "Four A.M." (L. Coleman) – 3:02 # "Five O'Clock Whistle" (Kim Gannon, Gene Irwin, Josef Myrow) – 2:06 # "Six Lessons from Madame La Zonga" (James V. Monaco) – 2:52 # "Seven-League Boots" – 2:46 # "Dinner at Eight" (Dorothy Fields, Jimmy McHugh) – 3:31 # "About a Quarter to Nine" (Al Dubin, Harry Warren) – 3:05 # "One the Ten O' Ten" (J. Fred Coots) – 2:20 # "At the Eleventh Hour" – 3:01 # "It's Twelve O'Clock" (Coots) – 3:34 ==Personnel== *Mavis Rivers – vocals *Nelson Riddle – arranger *Andy Wiswell – producer ==References== Category:1959 debut albums Category:Albums arranged by Nelson Riddle Category:Capitol Records albums Category:Mavis Rivers albums Category:Concept albums
title: Take a Number
